reviewText:
P.S: This review is based on MY experience, and reflects MY opinion.

+ Cute animals! Sleeping, running around!
+ You are an alien ship, kidnapping these animals without disturbing them to point of self-destruction. You gotta be smooth :O
+ Graphics are cartoon-like and colorful.
+ Sounds are fun and not annoying.
+ Lots of levels & multiplayer option.

Have fun.

reviewText: It is a very simple concept but still very enjoyable and a great time killer. It is also the best puzzler/ adventure game on the market which successfully combines farm animals and aliens. 4/5.\n

reviewText:
Im sitting here looking thro my screenshots and I´m laughing because its so funny to see the ships, bunnys, bulls and chicken run away. ask yourself THIS question: Have I ever wanted to abduct sheep (and cows and chickens) by using a small UFO to bully them into a bigger UFO?
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=359409491
If you answered yes, then: A. You are probably a very bad person (or an alien); and B. You just might enjoy Flock!

All Levels are different and challanging, its not easy to reach in all levels gold.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=359423721

You also can create your owen map, I tried it a bit out but a tutorial would be very helpfull for the first time. I didn`t tried the Multiplayer yet, and I think now there is no Multiplayer more because gamespy is dead.

I wish they would do this game Steamworks and add Steamworkshop so you can create and share your map and download maps from other player.

reviewText:
Flock! Flock! Flock!

I bought this Game on a sale for 99 Cents and it makes sooo much fun. Im sitting here, play that game and I´m laughing because its so funny to see the ships, bunnys, bulls and chicken run away. All Levels are different and challanging, its not easy to reach in all levels gold.

Game also works very smooth with my XBOX360 Gamepad.

You also can create your owen map, I tried it a bit out but a tutorial would be very helpfull for the first time. I didn`t tried the Multiplayer yet and I think now (2014) there is no Multiplayer more because gamespy is dead.

I wish they would do this game Steamworks and add Steamworkshop so you can create and share your map and download maps from other player.

I realy would give this game 10 points but since it only work 60% I have to give it 7 from 10 points.

Single player makes realy fun and 99 Cents (on sale price) its worth to buy.

reviewText: Sometimes in life we need to be introspective, and ask ourselves difficult questions...questions which require us to look deep within and examine the very essence of our core and being.\n\nWith that weighty premise in mind, ask yourself THIS question:  Have I ever wanted to abduct sheep (and cows and chickens) by using a small UFO to bully them into a bigger UFO?  If you answered yes, then:  A. You are probably a very bad person (or an alien); and B. You just might enjoy Flock!  I know I'M enjoying it, even if the experience is a tad frustrating at times (think ♥♥♥♥ me
date: soooo close...do I really have to play this level AGAIN?")...but on the whole
recommended: a very "cute" and cleverly-constructed puzzle game
hoursPlayed: and one that's not toooo hard (at least not so far...I'm up to level 15 or so).\n\nOh
voteText: and just in case you require further existential impetus:  MOST HILARIOUS SHEEP SOUND EFFECTS IN VIDEO GAME HISTORY.  And the music is pretty ♥♥♥♥in' groovy
helpfulPercent: too.  About the only thing it's severely lacking in is MONKEYS
votesTotal: you can't have everything (its longevity and replayability may also be up to some question
commentsCount: you'd have to be an ♥♥♥ to complain)...\n\nVerdict: 9/10."

reviewText:
This game ist totally hillarious while being absolutely serious fun at the same time.

All you have to do is chasing animals with your UFO to your mothership. Over time the levels get more difficult by adding obstacles, introducing various animal types to chase and even some enemies like wolves that can get really annoying while trying to do a double gold star rating on some of the levels.

As a child I had a toy that was an enclosed A4 shaped plasctic case with a clear top covering filled with little plastic pieces that you had to push around with a little truck that was moved by using a magnet under the bottom of the case. Somehow this game reminds me of it.

I had great fun with this thing during my childhood and man am a I having fun with this game here now.

I can totally recommend this game to everybody who likes a deep challenge from a game that looks so cute while being brutally difficult at times to master.

And the music ... you've got to listen to the music in the main menu. Man I love that sh*t oozing that 70's scifi flair out of every inch ...

(Though I have to admit while it's perfectly playable with your standard X-Box Controller, playing with your keyboard and mouse could get a little bit complicated as the difficulty keeps rising in the higher levels making it nearly impossible to win the missions without a controller ... you know what? This game is the perfect excuse for you to finally get yourself a Controller too ... I'm serious!)

Check the demo, have fun with it and then go an buy the game. It's totaly worth every penny they're asking for it.

reviewText: Herding sheep with a UFO is just about the least fun I've ever had while playing a computer game. I can't believe this game has restrictive DRM. What is it protecting? Nobody in their right mind would ever want to play this game. There's not one single thing about it that is fun. Take a reversed magnet and push metal screws around your desk -- you just played Flock in real life. Was it fun? If so you owe me 5 dollars.

reviewText: Annoying music. Well, I switched that off. But why do sheep get stuck behind trees? Considering the premnise, these little computer sheep seem a lot less frightened of an alien spaceship than real sheep are of a dog. You have to be right on top of them before they move, and then sometimes they move backwards! An exercise in frustration. I'd have been better off buying a loaf.

reviewText:
I remember playing this game when i was younger and it was one of my favourite games, i stumbled upon it on sale for $0.99 and felt like i was entitled to buy it as i now have a wider knowledge of games in general and can and can give this game a fair review.

Flock offers an intresting and unique puzzle system and has a lot of content for the amount of money i paid for it, there are many levels all with a difference to the last.

although this game is still fun and i still recomend it on sale, it was better when i was younger.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Though some of the levels are a bit tricky to get a gold perfect abduction on, it is possible...with some practice of course. The music is fitting and it's upbeat, the controls can be changed from to completely mouse, to completely keyboard...or a mix of the two. This is for a casual gamer, someone who enjoys playing games but isn't out to get into anything too serious and is more or less just looking for something to pass time on. Another benefit is that levels can be replayed at anytime, should you find yourself getting silver instead of gold. The game also provides upgrades throughout your playing experience so that you are not just stuck with threatening to abduct and can't.\n\nBottom line: if you're a casual gamer, like me...then this is for you.

reviewText: You control a flying saucer and try to herd animals while the run from you.  As you progress, the courses get a bit more challenging and you sometimes get upgraded.  It's not a very complicated game but there are quite a few levels to it.

reviewText: Genuinely enjoyable puzzle game.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Not really my style.  It's less a puzzle game, more a speed challenge.  Push the animals toward the mother ship, do your best to keep them from falling off a cliff or falling behind, and get the bare minimum there before the time runs out to seal your gold medal.  I don't think it's a bad game, so, strange as it may seem, I'm recommending it on a conditional basis.  If a more arcade-y, challenge-type game is what you're looking for have at it.  If you're wanting a cerebral experience, probably not.  (It does depend on how smart you are to begin with, I suppose.)
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: The game is pretty fun, but by no means easy.\n\nIt's difficulty lies most in the clumsiness which you can't avoid, being a spaceship herding sheep through obstacles in remote island locations. You're going to have a learning curve, but don't let it deter you. I'd play this game more often if I didn't have 30+ already from Steam and a handfull of go-to games among that number.
